title: Got another one for you guys :)
content:
This one I should know, but just cant remember the name of it.

| Attachment | Size |
| --- | --- |
| [velvetrope.jpg](http://web.archive.org/web/20080705154432/http:/typophile.com/files/velvetrope.jpg) | 42.97 KB |

 [‹ any guesses](http://web.archive.org/web/20080705154432/http:/www.typophile.com/node/27807 "Go to previous forum topic") [Need help to ID this font ›](http://web.archive.org/web/20080705154432/http:/www.typophile.com/node/27810 "Go to next forum topic")
author: retoid

comments.content:
Looks kinda like [Bernhard Fashion](http://web.archive.org/web/20080705154432/http:/www.myfonts.com/fonts/bitstream/bernhard-fashion/) that has had a lot of stroke thickness added.

- Mike Yanega
i dont think thats it, its close but not exact, you know now that I think of it, that looks easy enough to just draw.

Retoid: I think Mike is right here, actually....see the sample below that I just created doing exactly what he said.

 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20080705154432im_/http:/www.typophile.com/files/velvetrope_3877.png)

Obviously the \_V\_ and \_R\_ aren’t congruent with the sample but that would just take some simple scaling.
ok thank you, guess I didnt see it.
